events.name: BSC Open Hackathon 1: Saturday, Nov 17  - Sunday, Nov 18 (weekend)
events.about:
The hackathon will take place fromSaturday, Nov 17 at 9am - Sunday, Nov 18 8pm. 

This hackathon is the best place to work, network and perhaps even meet your future co-founding software engineer, designer, product guy, business geek, customer, employee or angel investor.

In the hacakthon you can either work on an existing or new project.

For startups it is  the best place to see people working on apps and APIs for your products.

Dont be afraid or shy. The hackathon is meant to be fun. We will build interdisciplinary teams. You do not need to be a software engineer to participate.

There will be enterprise/consumer angel investors and VCs at the hackathon. So it would a great environment to chitchat with investors in a relaxed atmosphere about your product/project; WesttechVentures +  Wellington + Hasso Plattner Ventures + Rocket Internet + Catagonia + Tarent AG

There will be free food and drinks on both days. Please write us an e-mail if you are vegetarian after buying a ticket in order  to order vegetarian food  also.

You can win an iPad/Kindle for hacks on Paymill.

 

We will build interdisciplinary teams at the hackathon on the Saturday morning. Each team will consists of software engineers, product guys, designers and business geeks. The software engineers will be coding, while the product guys  work on the product details,the designers take over the design and the business geeks the business side of the project.

On Sunday evening each team will have 5 minutes to demo and pitch their work + 5 minutes Q&A. The best 3 teams will win prizes.



Below are the list of topics:

Consumer

  1. Social
  2. Photo
  3. Couponing/daily deal services
  4. Payments (web, mobile)
  5. Mobile Advertising
  6. Games
  7. Real Estate
  8. Education
  9. Finance
  10. Music & Sound
  11. Travel

Enterprise

  1. Big data analytics
  2. Platform as a Service: PaaS

 

Schedule

Saturday

09:00:00 AM Reception + Registration

09:30:00 AM Introduction + Hackathon Agenda + Sponsor Pitches

10:00:00 AM Idea Pitches + Prices Annoucement

10:30:00 AM Team Building

11:00:00 AM Begin Hacking

01:00:00 PM Lunch (Free Food + Drinks)

02:00:00 PM Continue Work

06:30:00 PM Progress Updates From Groups

07:00:00 PM Dinner  (Free Food + Drinks)

08:00:00 PM Continue working overnight

Sunday

08:00:00 AM Breakfast (Free Food + Drinks)

09:00:00 AM Progress Updates From Groups

09:00:00 AM Continue Work

01:00:00 PM Lunch (Free Food + Drinks)

02:00:00 PM Continue Work

05:00:00 PM Pitch + Pitch Training

06:00:00 PM Hack Presentations 08:00:00 PM Closing

Please note that the deadline for purchasing a ticket  is Nov 14 as we will need time to prepare the event. No ticket can be purchased on the day of the hackathon. People without a ticket will not be allowed to enter the premise.

We are looking for further supporters for the hackathon. If you want to support organizing the hackathon, shoot us an e-mail.

Buy your ticket for the hackathon today on this page  or  on Eventbrite: http://goo.gl/FeGl3

events.name: Grails48 - Berlin
events.about: Grails48 is a global community hackathon series and startup mentorship program. Our first event newbie is taking place Nov 9-11th, 2012 online and in various locations. The purpose of Grails48 is to bring the Grails world together igniting innovation with our favorite JVM based tools and platforms.

events.name: WOWZAPP 2012: Worldwide Hackathon for Windows -- Berlin, Germany
events.about:
WOWZAPP Windows 8 Hackathon in Berlin

Melde dich jetzt an und werde Teil des weltweiten Windows 8 Hackathons! Vom 9. bis 11. November finden weltweit in über 40 Ländern Windows 8 Hackathons statt. Der deutsche Hackathon findet im Loft aka Dark Side Bakery in Berlin Mitte statt. Wir schalten live auf die anderen Kontinente und sind mit Microsoft Experten, Entwicklern und Trainern die gesamte Zeit vor Ort, um dir bei der Umsetzung deiner Ideen zu helfen. Der Hackathon startet am Freitag um 16h und Samstag und Sonntag jeweils um 10h. Nachtschichten sind nicht geplant aber auch nicht ausgeschlossen :)

Eine detaillierte Agenda gibt`s in Kürze

Voraussetzungen

Alles was du brauchst ist eine Idee und idealerweise schon ein paar Zeilen Code. Hier findest du alle Infos, Werkzeuge und Ressourcen

Windows Azure Mobile Services 

Wenn deine Idee einen Cloud Service anspricht, dann schau doch mal in den Windows Azure Mobile Services Guide

events.name: TV Hackday 2012 / Berlin
events.about:
Deutsche Version:

About

At TV Hackday well hack the future of TV. Developers, Designers, Concepter and TV Stations alike will work together to do remixes, Apps, Hacks or the next TV Set. Anything goes as long as it is a TV related project that can be done till Sunday afternoon. TV offers a lot possibilities to hack and with two brand new APIs that will be made public for the first time well have the opportunity to create something new & exciting. Besides having a fun two days we want to demo the resulting hacks on Sunday afternoon to participants and anyone else interested.

Shedule

Start: October 20th, 10am

  • Welcome / Short Introduction
  • API Oververview
  • Project Pitches
  • Hacking commences till Open End

21. Oktober

  • Hacking continues
  • Assembling the Demo

Demo time: Oktober 21st @ 4pm

Drinks & Food will be provided.

More Info: http://tvhackday.com/index_en.php

Partner

Food Sponsor

Location Sponsor

Deutsche Version

Beim TV Hackday arbeiten wir zwei Tage lang an Projekten zur Zukunft des Fernsehens. Programmierer, Konzepter, Designer, Startups und TV-Macher kreieren gemeinsam Remixes, Apps, Services, Produkte, Inhalte oder den nächsten Fernseher. Alles ist erlaubt solange es etwas mit TV zu tun hat und bis zur Demo am Sonntag umsetzbar ist.

Als Bonus werden beim TV Hackday zum ersten Mal zwei neue Schnittstellen freigegeben an denen wir uns austoben können. Ziel ist es am Ende der zwei Tage lauffähige Ergebnisse zu haben, die am Sonntag Abend allen Teilnehmern plus interessierten Gästen präsentiert werden.

Ablauf

Beginn: 20. Oktober 10 Uhr

  • Kurze Hackday Einführung / Organisatorisches
  • Vorstellung der Schnittstellen
  • Pitchen der Hack-Ideen
  • Arbeit an den Hacks bis Open End

21. Oktober

  • Fertigstellen der Hacks
  • Erstellen der Demo

Demo: 21. Oktober 16 Uhr

Für Getränke und Essen ist gesorgt.

Partner

Essens Sponsor

Location Sponsor

Weitere Informationen: http://tvhackday.com/

events.name: Photo Hack Day
events.about:
Good to see you again!

Photo Hack Day brings the most innovative developers and designers to Berlin to hack the future of photography. The goal of the event is to rapidly prototype and build new projects, powering through the night to present a finished product Sunday afternoon. 

After a smashing debut in February 2012, Photo Hack Day goes to the next level on the weekend of September 22 + 23 2012 in Berlin.

It’s going to be bigger and better than ever before. Seats are limited, so register now to secure your tickets!d

events.name: Creatathon Berlin 2012
events.about:
Am 18. Juli geht es los: G-Texchnology startet den ersten deutschen “Creatathon” und ihr könnt dabei sein. Bewerbt euch hier für euren exklusiven Platz im Kreativteam von iSenseven und G-Technology!

 

Worum geht es?

 

Unser Creatathon ist die kreative Version eines Hackathons: Gemeinsam mit der professionellen Film-Crew von iSenseven und Steffen Willhelm, einem preisgekrönten Amateurfilmer, erstellt ihr am 18. Juli ein anspruchsvolles Multimediaprojekt. An einem Tag. Für einen guten Zweck. 

Die Teilnahme ist beschränkt auf 26 Personen. Mitmachen können Profis und erfahrene Amateure aus den Bereichen Film, Fotografie, Musik und Animation.


Wofür die ganze Action?


Mit dem Output des Creatathon unterstützen wir das alternative Bildungsprogramm der filmArche – Europa’s erster selbstorganisierter Filmschule. Der gemeinnützige Verein aus Berlin verhilft Filminteressierten, die es sich sonst nicht leisten könnten, zu einer hochwertigen Ausbildung im Filmbereich. Über 200 Filmschaffende treffen sich regelmäßig in Berlin-Kreuzberg, um sich gemeinsam fortzubilden, voneinander zu lernen - und natürlich um Filme zu machen. Neben den eigenen Studenten ist die filmArche offen für alle, die sich für die Filmproduktion begeistern und bietet auch Nicht-Mitgliedern Veranstaltungen und Workshops zu einem moderaten Preis.


Ihr führt die Regie!

 

Die filmArche bietet Raum für eine kritische und experimentelle Auseinandersetzung mit dem Thema Film. Sie steht außerdem für Selbstorganisation und Eigenverantwortung. Das offene Prinzip der filmArche bestimmt auch das Thema dieses Projekts: Ziel ist es ein Multimedia-Produkt zu schaffen, das die Grundidee Selbstorganisation vermittelt und den alternativen Ansatz der filmArche widerspiegelt.

Wie genau ihr das Motto umsetzt entscheidet ihr! Das Projekt muss kein Image-Film werden. Es kann ein flippiger Trailer werden, eine emotionale Fotostory, eine seriöse Webreportage oder ein lustiger Film. Oder etwas komplett anderes. Ihr könnt – im Team oder alleine - mit Animationen arbeiten, eine kreative Foto-Strecke entwerfen, das Projekt um ein Musikstück herumbauen oder einfach einen guten Film machen.

 

It’s going to be fun!


Im Mittelpunkt des Creatathons steht der Austausch, das gemeinsame Produzieren  – und ihr sollt Spaß dabei haben. Die erfahrene Crew von iSenseven steht euch während des ganzen Tages zur Seite und teilt mit euch wertvolle Tipps und Tricks. Steffen Wilhelm, der mit seinem Film We miss you unter anderem G-Technology’s „Driven Creativity Award 2011“ gewonnen hat, ist mit von der Partie und wird seine Erfahrungen mit euch teilen. G-Technology kümmert sich um die Rahmenbedingungen: Wir stellen die Location, sorgen für leckeres Essen, ausreichende Getränke und die neueste Technik - damit ihr alles habt, was ihr braucht um ein großartiges Werk zu kreieren!

 

Mit der Teilnahme am Creatathon 2012 tretet ihr die Rechte an den produzierten Werken zugunsten der filmArche ab. Die filmArche wird sie dazu verwenden, ihre  Bekanntheit zu erhöhen und weitere Unterstützer zu finden. Weitere Informationen zu den Teilnahmebedingungen inklusive Bild- und Verwertungsrechten folgen in Kürze.

events.name: BeMyApp Berlin - Music Hackathon with Deezer
events.about: Create and develop iOS, Android and Web applications. Be ready to design innovative apps during this music special BeMyApp WeekEnd in partnership with Deezer.

events.name: Google I/O Extended Berlin 2012
events.about:
Didnt get a ticket for the I/O at Mountain View and are around the Berlin Area during that time?
Forget the 900$ ticket fee, forget booking the flight to the States, forget the pain of the actual travel and just enjoy in the comfort of the c-base space station instead.
For the second time the c-base is proud to be hosting the Google I/O Extended in Berlin and YOU are invited to join our Googly happening.

Program:

On Wednesday and Thursday at noon the c-base will be hosting a freestyle Hackathon around all Google APIs.
Get together with other enthusiasts, enhance your skills and .

At 18:00 well switch the Context and set focus over to Mountain View and will watch the streams from the I/O at the Google Headquarters.

//TODO initialize amount
There will be amount seperate rooms showing the voted tracks. After you have registered for a day you can vote on the amount Sessions you want to see.

Join us on board of the Mother of all Hackerspaces that crashed Berlin a long time ago and has been home to all sorts of creative minds.
You can work either on software or improve your skills with the hardware side of the ADK.

Test your Android application on devices that the c-base has to offer.
From first generation mobile phone, two Google TV boxes and a variety of tablets.

TL;DR: Come or cry, its going to be awesome!

events.name: Hack4Europe! 2012 - Berlin
events.about:
Hack4Europe! is a series of hack days organised by the Europeana Foundation and its partners and provides an exciting environment to explore the potential of open cultural data for social and economic growth in Europe. To feel the atmosphere to the event you can read a short summary of one of the events from the last year edition.

Hack4Europe! 2012 Berlin will be organised by the Europeana Collections 1914-1918 project at Staatsbibliothek zu Berlin.

The hackathon will bring together up to 30 developers from Germany and other European countries . They will have access to the diverse and rich Europeana collections containing over 20 million records through the Europeana Search API (incl. a test key and technical documentation).

Participants will be encouraged to try out their ideas for creative reuse of the Europeana content and build prototypes showcasing the social and business value of open cultural data. The suggested (but not obligatory) themes are:

  • World War One: Special attention will be on applications built to showcase the human interest side of world war one. A focus on this theme for the Berlin event is appreciated, but is not obligatory.

Further themes:

  • Going mobile: Applications that bring Europeana to the mobile devices be they smartphones or tablets! Take advantage of geo-data and geo-awareness.
  • Mashing-up: Mash-up with other APIs and combine and enrich Europeana content with other free content from e.g. Wikipedia.
  • Social curation: Applications that allow users to curate Europeana content a share it with the world and each others on social platforms.
  • User annotations: Applications that let users enrich Europeana objects with comments, tags, links to external sources, or links to other Europeana objects. This can be in the form of a game.

You can find out more about prototypes developed during previous hackathons on this website.

Best prototypes will be awarded prizes in the four categories:

  • greatest social impact
  • most innovative 
  • best commercial viability
  • developers’ pick (voted by hackathon participants)

Winners from the individual hackathons will be then further evaluated and one finalist per category will be invited and awarded a special prize during the Digital Agenda Assembly on 21-22 June in Brussels.

PRACTICAL INFORMATION

  1. Developers must register in advance to indicate their interest. Depending on the demand for the event, organisers will decide on the final delegate list and send a confirmation e-mail to the selected ones about two weeks prior to the events.  Registration closes on 18 May, or earlier if we will reach the maximum number of participants. Please register as soon as you can  to be able to receive the final confirmation e-mail in a time which will allow you to arrange your participation. 
  2. The ownership of prototypes and ideas developed during the contest belongs to teams which developed these prototypes and ideas. Also these teams are responsible for all legal issues related to developed prototypes (e.g. compatibility with the license of used open-source software components).
  3. Hackathon is organized as an international event, the language used in all official parts of the event will be English. This is also the language in which the Europeana API technical documentation is available.
  4. The event agenda will not be strongly structured to give a lot of flexibility to the participants.

events.name: Berlin Hackathon 2012 Wikimedia Foundation
events.about:
If youre a smart developer or designer and want to build an application on top of Wikipedia, or using Wikipedia content, participate in our hackathon in Berlin (Friday, June 1st to Sunday, June 3rd). Well bring together Wikipedias senior coders with new developers to build applications running in Wikipedia itself, on mobile devices, or based on Wikipedias content and data.

This is a free event put on by Wikimedia Germany and the Wikimedia Foundation, the non-profit that runs Wikipedia. Youll get a brief overview of all the key technologies you need, and then youll have a weekend to build something amazing and make it open source. At the end, show it off and take the next step to get it running on our servers. Join us Friday night for drinks and conversations, and get ready for a weekend of coding. Food and drinks provided. :-)

Well introduce you to:

  • Lua: teaching people Lua, overhauling some templates
  • Gadgets 2.0: teaching people how to use ResourceLoader, moving some gadgets into the new central repository and refactoring them to use RL
  • Wikidata: making design decisions and building

 

Agenda

Friday, June 1st: Intro & Mixer

5pm onwards: general hacking

 

Saturday, June 2nd: Workshops & Hacking

10am onwards: general hacking

conference room, morning: hands-on tutorials on Lua and on Gadgets 2.0
conference room, afternoon: short presentations

 

Sunday, June 3rd: Some More Hacking & Showcase

10am onwards: general hacking

events.name: Berlin Startup Weekend
events.about:
There is no need to evoke the up-and-about nature of the Berlin startup scene in order to explain why a Startup Weekend Berlin is taking place, is there? Please mark your calendars for May 4th – 6th for the  3rd  Startup Weekend Berlin – in the context of Berlin Web Week 2012, flanked by re:publica and NEXT12.

At the event’s core is the same concept that has drawn over 10,000 prior attendees worldwide: startup enthusiasts of different backgrounds come together, share and pitch ideas, form teams and work an entire weekend to finally present a (minimally viable) product to a panel of experts – and then – maybe –  launch a startup.  Startup Weekend Berlin is hoping to further connect  the vibrant creative community of Berlin with the equally thriving startup community.  In any case, everybody will  go home with new (and yes! important) contacts , potential co-workers and an inspired feeling ( … and possibly a dire case of sleep deprivation.)

What about the co-events of Startup Weekend Berlin 2012? Meet us at Startup Thursday Club on April 12th. And get ready for Startup Radical Game on April 16th – part of a creative workshop that combines micro-trends and adapts ideas for your brand, powered by TrendONE.

events.name: SAP CodeJam Berlin
events.about:
Remember Hacker Night? Well, SAP is bringing it back under a new format called CodeJam. This new concept offers an opportunity for you as a developer to not only get your hands on SAP’s latest technologies but also to put yourself to the test and to code, hack and create with your peers.

 

SAP CodeJam Berlin will focus on Mobile technologies. As a participant, you’ll get access to the entire SAP Mobile Platform including tools, sandboxes, experts, and more! In the days prior to the event, youll receive an email with a checklist and a couple of links that will help you get prepared. Additional information can be found here. 

 

So, put yourself to the test and sign up for CodeJam Berlin now! The event is free, but space is limited.

 

 

Other SAP CodeJam Events:

  • April 25 - SAP CodeJam London (Register)
  • May 1 - SAP CodeJam Tel Aviv (Register)

events.name: BeMyApp Berlin - The 2012 Mobile App Olympics for Hackers & Designers
events.about:
Welcome to all Creatives, Hackers & Designers

BeMyApp 2012 is a three-day mobile app hackathon.

Build a mobile app within 48 hours!

BeMyApp wants to help you build successful startups around the next generation mobile applications and to foster a global community of entrepreneurs. 

Registered idea generators are given 1 minute to pitch an app concept to a tech audience on day one. Attending engineers and designers as well as our team of glorious mentors preselect the best ideas that will be developed into applications during the weekend.

Teams are formed around the most promising projects and the competition begins.

Open for all mobile platforms: iOS, Android, Windows, Web

The next BeMyApp WeekEnd will be dedicated to all mobile platforms — both native and Web apps — and will take place in 7 cities around the world.

Lets show the world what Made in Berlin means!

Each country will nominate its best app to compete in the finals. A 48 hours worldwide vote will be launched and a worldwide winner will be selected.

The winner will receive the Gold Medal in Mobile Apps!

More information:

- Blog: http://de.bemyapp.com/blog

- Website: http://de.bemyapp.com

- Twitter: @BeMyAppGermany

- Facebook event: BeMyApp Berlin

- Facebook page: BeMyApp Germany

All applications built during the weekend belong to the participants only.

Register now — we have only limited available seats!

Schedule

FRIDAY, FEBRUARY 24TH

7pm - Opening

8pm - Idea Pitches

9pm - Team Creation

10pm - Brainstorming and First Lines of Code

1am - Closing

SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 25TH

9am - Opening

12pm - First Video CheckPoint

12am - Closing

SUNDAY, FEBRUARY 26TH

9am - Opening

12pm - Second Video CheckPoint

7pm - First Demos Presented

9pm - Winner Announcement (public)

afterwards: Party (details see below)

-----

MONDAY, FEBRUARY 27TH

9am - Online vote opening

THURSDAY, MARCH 1ST

8am - AppOlympics winner announcement

Catering

No worries! Of course, well provide you with pizza, drinks, Club Mate, and all the stuff a creative mobile guru needs. You sit down, we take care. Nobody will starve, thats for sure!

Prizes

Prizes for the winning team
  • A €1.337 voucher for a flight to Silicon Valley
  • A voucher for a one week stay for two team members at the Blackbox Mansion (by Blackbox)
  • A book surprise package kindly provided by OReilly
  • A one-month startup coaching organized by Found Fair Ventures
  • Squarespace will provide a Squarespace Business Package ($480 value).
  • A licence of Tower a Git client for Mac for every team member
Freebies for all participants
  • Nokia offers free Nokia Lumia 800 devices and AppHub vouchers for Windows Phone developers.
  • Storage Room will provide 6-month free accounts for all participants (up to a certain limit).
  • HockeyApp gives away free 6-month Indie Accounts for all participants.
  • Toast will sponsor 20 beer crates of fresh Carlsberg beer. Cheers!
Were still looking for partners & sponsors. Please contact us!

Jury

The winner will be determined by our jury. Want to be part of the jury?

Accomodation

http://www.airbnb.com/berlin-germany
http://pfefferbett.de/


Sponsors & Partners

   
         

   
 
      
 
   


Media partners

   

   

Press

Please download our Press Kit including the official press release, all sponsor logos, and pictures of the location here:

Press Kit (English & German)

Share

- Facebook event: BeMyApp Berlin

- Facebook page: BeMyApp Germany

Party

On sunday evenning just in time for the winner announcement we open our doors for the public to celebrate with us the first Berlin AppOlympics. There will be music, drinks and greate people. Participants of the AppOlympics dont need a seperate ticket, everyone else who wants to join our party are kindly ask to get a (limited) ticket here.
